trans-unit.source: We sincerely apologize, but there seems to be a technical issue with starting your consult. We've already pinged our top engineers to investigate and resolve the issue. If you need further assistance, please don't hesitate to contact our Quality Care Team at support@healthtap.com. If you cannot start your consult in time, we will fully re-credit your account. (Error code: %{error})

It appears your account is already currently in a live virtual consult with a doctor. Please continue your consult from that browser window or device. For further assistance, please contact our Quality Care Team at support@healthtap.com. (Error code: %{error})

We're sorry but you must be 18 years or older to start a Virtual Consult with a doctor. We can't start your consult at this time. For questions, please contact our Quality Care Team at support@healthtap.com. If you cannot start your consult in time, we will fully re-credit your account. (Error code: %{error})

We sincerely apologize, but there was an issue charging your account for this virtual consult. We can't start your consult until this issue is resolved. For further assistance, please contact our Quality Care Team at support@healthtap.com. (Error code: %{error})
Sorry, you've been removed from this consult and may not join again. (Error code: %{error})
Sorry, but this consult has reached the maximum number of allowed participants. (Error code: %{error})
Sorry, this consult has already ended. (Error code: %{error})
Sorry, this consult has not yet started. Try again later. (Error code: %{error})
Sorry, this appointment has been canceled. (Error code: %{error})
You already exceed the number of consults you are allowed to

We sincerely apologize, but the Doctor is temporarily unavailable. For further assistance, please contact our Quality Care Team at support@healthtap.com. (Error code: %{error})

We sincerely apologize, but there seems to be a technical issue with starting your consult. We've already pinged our top engineers to investigate and resolve the issue. If you need further assistance, please don't hesitate to contact our Quality Care Team at expertsupport@healthtap.com. (Error code: %{error})

It appears this consult has already been ended, either because it was answered or the patient hung up. If you need further assistance, please don't hesitate to contact our Quality Care Team at expertsupport@healthtap.com. (Error code: %{error})

We sincerely apologize, but it seems you are offline potentially due to a missed call. If you need further assistance, please don't hesitate to contact our Quality Care Team at expertsupport@healthtap.com. (Error code: %{error})
Please enter a valid device ID and passcode combination (Error code: %{error})
Sorry, there was an error assigning this device. (Error code: %{error})
Sorry, there was an error unassigning this device. This may happen if there are pending future appointments on this device. (Error code: %{error})

Start adding content to your profile by answering questions from users that interests you - this is the number 1 way to start generating traffic to your profile. Share the answers on FB and Twitter by selecting the appropriate channel after completing the answer. This can also be done from the "settings" link on the Virtual Practice home page.

Build your network of patients and colleagues. Your network size directly impacts your online reputation by attracting the attention of more specialists who will read and "Agree" with your answers - and patients who will "Thank" you. It also helps optimize your visibility to internet search engines. Recent analysis of our top doctors showed a direct correlation between network size and number of “Agrees” and "Thanks". (click here to invite colleagues or patients).

You can offer your patients different types of consults, such as asynchronous messaging during text chat consults or live high-definition video consults. For example, follow-up appointments and pre-op evaluations can be done virtually.

You can set the prices for each type of Virtual Consult. This includes Live Consults, which can occur anytime without scheduling during your Virtual Office Hours; Inbox Consults, which are asynchronous messages; and Virtual Appointments. During these virtual consults, you can provide medical advice, order and refill prescriptions, order and review lab tests, and more!
The ultimate scheduling flexibility: you can set your Virtual Office Hours anytime you like. This is when you’ll be online and available for virtual consults with your patients.

Customized marketing materials and HealthTap’s proprietary email tool make it easier than ever to share and communicate about your Virtual Practice with your patients. You can also connect your social media accounts and add a HealthTap Medical Expert widget to your website.

To have someone tell you you saved his life is the best feeling in the world. Six people have told me I saved their life. I haven't experienced that level of professional satisfaction in a long time. Nothing in medicine is more satisfying for doctor and patient than to have one on one time to listen to each other in a relaxed environment without interruption

HealthTap is the future of medicine, and I'm really excited to be part of the transformation. How could I not be excited to be part of the next big change in how health care is both delivered and perceived?
HealthTap is nothing short of amazing. I love it and I love working on it. I find myself to be amongst the luckiest people to have a job they love and get to help people at the same time.
HealthTap helps me feel like a virtuoso in medicine by reconnecting me to colleagues and patients
I feel a renewed sense of humanitarianism. I am inspired and connected.
I plan to invite my patients to join so that on my weekend they can ask for me if it is my shift.

What was impossible a year ago, is now POSSIBLE. I'd have to say that each consult has been impactful, because each case is so different. It is unbelievable, the camaraderie, support, and peer-led education that's available for free. The EMR is also fantastic and quick to browse through.

I think HealthTap will revolutionize medical care. I'm so thrilled to be using HealthTap to connect with patients and physicians from around the world. I have over 8000 followers on HealthTap---that's incredible.
...this technology can and has been INVALUABLE
The consults I have had were fun to do, interesting too!

After the consult, you’ll be able to securely access the doctor’s summary on HealthTap, including any prescriptions, referrals, and checklists for you.
Doctors will also provide you with recommended actions or a checklist following you consult, reminding you what you can do.

Reminders related to any recommended actions or any checklist provided to you by your doctor will automatically be sent to you by email and (if you have HealthTap on your mobile device) mobile notification.

These reminders are tailored to you and your consult. They may contain information related to treatments and medications (including prescriptions) and other personal health-related information specific to your virtual consult. You can opt out of receiving these notifications by email or your mobile device at any time
Never use HealthTap Prime in an emergency situation. Always call %{emergency_number} or your local emergency service immediately if you think you may have an emergency.

Don’t use HealthTap Prime if you have a serious injury or condition (such as chest pain, seizures, difficulty breathing, burns, or any critical or life-threatening situation. Also, don’t use HealthTap prime for mental, behavioral, or addiction issues.
Checklists are a great way to stay engaged with your health. These checklists contain reminders about actions you can take to reach health goals, manage health conditions, and feel good.
Marking actions as “complete” gives doctors important information for your next Virtual Consult. They'll know how to better tailor your treatments based on the actions you’ve taken in the past.
When you subscribe to a checklist, you’ll automatically receive reminders via email and push notification. Of course, you can always opt out of these reminders at any time.

When you subscribe to a checklist, we'll send you the reminders you see in the checklist by email and, if you have the HealthTap mobile app, by push notification. You control what reminders are sent to you, and where they're sent. This ensures that reminders are truly useful to you.
You control the utility, and the privacy, of the reminders you receive.

to make it meaningful, answerable, and easy to understand.
Questions must be in English, easy to understand, and about health or wellness topics.

Questions must include enough detail to be meaningful and answerable. Naming a topic (for example, “headache?”) without asking something specific, doesn’t give the doctor enough information to accurately answer. You can consider mentioning gender, duration, age range, or body area affected.

Medications in different countries use different names, so be sure to include the generic name of the medication. Our experts are U.S.-licensed doctors and rarely answer questions about uniquely foreign medications they are not familiar with, or about hospitals or procedures in other countries that they have not visited.
Do not include your name, names of other people, or doctors’ names.
We do not answer questions from minors under the age of 16, so parents should ask questions for teens and children.

trans-unit.resname:
Sweat the details... at least a little. Hide examples
Good: I had an itchy dry rash on the inside of my elbows for 3 weeks. What could be the causes?
Not so good: Why do I have a rash?
trans-unit.source:
Sweat the details... at least a little. Hide examples
Good: I had an itchy dry rash on the inside of my elbows for 3 weeks. What could be the causes?
Not so good: Why do I have a rash?

trans-unit.resname:
Make it long enough to be helpful to others. Millions of people all over the world may read your question and its answers. Show examples
Good: What could cause low back pain after doing chores in the house – I’ve never had a back injury?
Not so good: Why back pain?
trans-unit.source:
Make it long enough to be helpful to others. Millions of people all over the world may read your question and its answers. Show examples
Good: What could cause low back pain after doing chores in the house – I’ve never had a back injury?
Not so good: Why back pain?

trans-unit.resname:
Include sex/gender, when relevant. Show examples
Sex/Gender helpful: What could cause a lump, the size of a quarter, just under a man’s breast.
Sex/Gender not necessary: What could cause a rubbery bump, the size of a jelly bean, under the skin on the back of my hand?
trans-unit.source:
Include sex/gender, when relevant. Show examples
Sex/Gender helpful: What could cause a lump, the size of a quarter, just under a man’s breast.
Sex/Gender not necessary: What could cause a rubbery bump, the size of a jelly bean, under the skin on the back of my hand?

trans-unit.resname:
Include an approximate age. Show examples
Different ages will lead to different answers: For the past 2 days my 15 year old son has had a fever and been limping as if his leg hurts. What are some things that could cause this?
Why has my 3 year old been experiencing some fever and limping as if his leg hurts for the past 2 days?
trans-unit.source:
Include an approximate age. Show examples
Different ages will lead to different answers: For the past 2 days my 15 year old son has had a fever and been limping as if his leg hurts. What are some things that could cause this?
Why has my 3 year old been experiencing some fever and limping as if his leg hurts for the past 2 days?

trans-unit.resname:
Include weight, height and dosage units, where relevant. Show examples
Good: My son is 3 years old, weights 27 pounds, and is 34 inches tall. Is his size OK for his age?
Not so good: My son is 3, weighs 27, and has a height of 34. Is he OK for his age?
trans-unit.source:
Include weight, height and dosage units, where relevant. Show examples
Good: My son is 3 years old, weights 27 pounds, and is 34 inches tall. Is his size OK for his age?
Not so good: My son is 3, weighs 27, and has a height of 34. Is he OK for his age?

trans-unit.resname:
Please use both brand and generic names for medications, especially if you’re outside of the U.S. or asking about an uncommon medication. Show examples
Good: My son is 5 years old, 55lbs, and has a fever. He took 5ml of Tylenol (acetaminophen120mg/5ml), but his fever persists. Can children of this weight and age take a bigger dose of Tylenol?
Not so good: My son is 5, weighs 55, and has a fever. Tried Tylenol but fever persists. Take more Tylenol?
trans-unit.source:
Please use both brand and generic names for medications, especially if you’re outside of the U.S. or asking about an uncommon medication. Show examples
Good: My son is 5 years old, 55lbs, and has a fever. He took 5ml of Tylenol (acetaminophen120mg/5ml), but his fever persists. Can children of this weight and age take a bigger dose of Tylenol?
Not so good: My son is 5, weighs 55, and has a fever. Tried Tylenol but fever persists. Take more Tylenol?

trans-unit.resname:
Try to avoid questions that set doctors up for a YES or NO answer. Show examples
Good: How do antibiotics work in young, school-aged children?
Not so good: Do antibiotics work in children?
trans-unit.source:
Try to avoid questions that set doctors up for a YES or NO answer. Show examples
Good: How do antibiotics work in young, school-aged children?
Not so good: Do antibiotics work in children?

trans-unit.resname:
Try to leave opinions out. Show examples
Good: Why are some people against vaccines, when vaccines are used to prevent bad diseases?
Not so good: Are those anti-vaccine folks completely clueless or just in denial?
trans-unit.source:
Try to leave opinions out. Show examples
Good: Why are some people against vaccines, when vaccines are used to prevent bad diseases?
Not so good: Are those anti-vaccine folks completely clueless or just in denial?

trans-unit.resname:
The clearer, the better. Use good grammar, avoid profanities and stay away from slang. Show examples
Good: I was doing arm curls and felt a burning pain in my biceps. Could I have torn a muscle?
Not so good: Doing curls, felt something and arm hurts?
trans-unit.source:
The clearer, the better. Use good grammar, avoid profanities and stay away from slang. Show examples
Good: I was doing arm curls and felt a burning pain in my biceps. Could I have torn a muscle?
Not so good: Doing curls, felt something and arm hurts?

trans-unit.resname:
Don’t assume personal historical knowledge. HealthTap doctors often will not have seen your previous questions. Show examples
Good: My 2 year old son got ear tubes two months and now has a fever and pus coming from his right ear. Is this common?
Not so good: And it’s been going on for two days, and pus is coming out too?
trans-unit.source:
Don’t assume personal historical knowledge. HealthTap doctors often will not have seen your previous questions. Show examples
Good: My 2 year old son got ear tubes two months and now has a fever and pus coming from his right ear. Is this common?
Not so good: And it’s been going on for two days, and pus is coming out too?

trans-unit.resname:
To maintain privacy, leave your name and the names of others out (unless that “other” is a celebrity who has publicly talked about an issue). Show examples
Good: I just heard the actor Michael J. Fox talk about his Parkinson’s disease. Are there any new, good treatments that have come out in the last 3 years?
Not so good: Hello doctor. My name is John Doe, and I am wondering if there are any good treatments for Parkinson’s disease.
trans-unit.source:
To maintain privacy, leave your name and the names of others out (unless that “other” is a celebrity who has publicly talked about an issue). Show examples
Good: I just heard the actor Michael J. Fox talk about his Parkinson’s disease. Are there any new, good treatments that have come out in the last 3 years?
Not so good: Hello doctor. My name is John Doe, and I am wondering if there are any good treatments for Parkinson’s disease.

trans-unit.resname:
Avoid using too many abbreviations because these can get downright confusing. Show examples
Good: How do you know if you are pregnant, if you never have regular periods?
Not so good: How do u no ur prego if u never have reg periods?
trans-unit.source:
Avoid using too many abbreviations because these can get downright confusing. Show examples

Not so good: How do u no ur prego if u never have reg periods?

trans-unit.resname:
Ask in English. This is the language commonly used by doctors on HealthTap. Show examples
Good: I pruned some trees last weekend and my arm has been hurting for 2 days. Could this be the cause?
Not so good: Porque mi brazo me duele mucho esta semana?
trans-unit.source:

Working knowledge with major QA tools, bug tracking systems and automation tools
Actively help define the roadmap for HealthTap's mobile applications
Now you can get top doctor lists for free from HealthTap. Rankings are comprehensive, reliable and customizable. You get the lists you want, when you want them.
Lists can be used in connection with everything from special issues dedicated to best doctors to one-off articles. Sign up for access today!
Patients, share your thanks for a doctor who's made a difference in your life. Doctors, share notes of appreciation from your patients.
Useful health tips + beautiful images, delivered daily. Choose from 100 helpful topics.

If you can improve a description on HealthTap simply select "Edit description" and make your changes. These will take effect immediately, and you'll be identified as the most recent editor to the Topic description.

After you Thank an Expert, you'll have an opportunity to add a Thank You Note. Thank You Notes show added appreciation, and experts can post these notes to their Virtual Practices. (Please do not include any questions or information in these notes, and only send what you agree can be publicly shared).

HealthTap’s now gives you instant access to the latest peer-reviewed medical research, together with insights about it and comments on it from the medical experts on HealthTap. Have a question about a published study? We’ve got you covered – you can send a public question to our network, or even ask the doctor of your choice a question about the research via a Private Conversation on HealthTap.
Want clarification? Ask a question about the article to our community of experts, or even enter into a Private Conversation about it with the doctor you choose.
Want to know what other doctors think of the research? Read the comments posted by medical experts, and learn what they have to say.
Want to learn more? Quickly find other related publications on HealthTap, including similar research or articles by the same authors.

At Waikato District Health Board ("Waikato DHB"), your privacy is important to us. This document gives you details about SmartHealth and how your information will be used and kept secure.

A "Consult" within SmartHealth system will allow you to have either a video (using a computer, a video camera and a microphone) consultation or a typed / text consultation with a Waikato DHB clinician. During the consultation, the Waikato DHB clinician will update information about the consultation (e.g. information they provided you during the consultation such as diagnosis or treatment). This information will be stored in SmartHealth system and also sent to update your clinical record maintained at Waikato DHB and the Primary Health Organisation (e.g. your GP) that you are registered with, just as if they saw you in person.

Standard virtual consults: In these consults, doctors who have accepted you as a patient (whether for “on call” care, unless you already have an ongoing care relationship with the doctor) can provide care. You may receive an examination (within the limits of virtual care), provide a medical history, obtain an assessment from a physician, and receive a treatment plan as determined to be medically appropriate by the consulting doctor.

Introductory Consult: this is the first interaction with a new doctor or a doctor who has not yet accepted you as a patient on HealthTap. An introductory consult is not intended for the doctor to give you care. Introductory consults are for providing you with information or get to know the doctor and to determine if she or he can help you with your health concern (in person and/or through virtual consults). A doctor may need to invite you to her or his office for an in person appointment in order to accept you as a patient on HealthTap.

HealthTap is intended to give you easy access to health information (and even care) on your computer or mobile device. As a HealthTap patient (with a HealthTap Prime membership or other access to consulting doctors on HealthTap), you are entitled to receive medically necessary and appropriate care, and you agree not to abuse or overuse the access to doctors provided to you. Overuse includes requests for multiple opinions on single medical condition HealthTap consults should not be used : to obtain numerous opinions on a single medical condition. In general, doctors may discourage this practice and may be hesitant to provide an assessment to those patients who attempt to seek multiple consults. In cases where there is an absolute medical necessity, it may be appropriate to do more than one consult in a day about a specific health issue, but you may also need to consider seeking in-person care or emergency services if the level of severity truly is at the point where multiple consults are warranted (especially if in-person care is recommended by a consulting doctor on HealthTap).

If you signed up for a free trial or limited-period discount HealthTap Prime account, and allow the trial or discount period to expire, your account will automatically convert to a standard paid subscription account (starting your full-price subscription period and recurring charges). For the first month of your full-price paid subscription only, you have a 72-hour grace period to notify HealthTap Support in writing if you do not want to continue the subscription and/or to request a refund of your first month’s full-price subscription fee. This grace-period does not apply if you have engaged in one or more consults after the free-trial period. You may cancel your subscription at any time, and your subscription will be valid through the then current pre-paid month. HealthTap does not offer partial-month refunds.

HealthTap Prime offers primary-care consults from specific physicians on HealthTap only. Consults for specialist care are not available on HealthTap Prime. HealthTap Prime consults are available under an “on call” model where you will be connected with the first-available HealthTap Prime physician. If you wish to or do select a specific doctor (including specialists) to consult, these consults are part of the HealthTap Concierge service, are not included in your HealthTap Prime subscription, and are subject to additional per-consult fees. HealthTap Prime may not cover the cost of consults that originated from searching for a specific doctor or specialty. Pricing for any Concierge consults will be shown prior to initiating such consults and by participating in such a consult you agree to pay the fees associated with such a consult.

HealthTap allows members to “connect with” doctors. HealthTap does not reveal your real name or any other Personally Identifiable Information to doctors when you Follow or Connect with them. Questions and answers on HealthTap are for general education and information. Only general, informational questions are permitted. For specific, personal health questions, always ask your own doctor or healthcare provider. (HealthTap Medical Experts are not your personal doctor or healthcare provider, and their answers to questions are not personal or for personal use.) These questions are private (not visible on HealthTap to other members or doctors) and secure. HealthTap does not share your Personally Identifiable Information (for example, your real name or email address) with anyone unless you permit it. HealthTap works by helping you find reliable and personalized health information. As part of this service, HealthTap may provide you with information about external service providers (“Service Providers”) that may be of interest or use to you (for example, a health clinic). HealthTap does not provide these external Service Providers with any Personally Identifiable Information about you, without your express consent. Service Providers cannot access your Health Activity or other health and wellness information through HealthTap.

Some members may want to share personal information with a Service Provider. You can always do this on your own. If we allow this in the future, before you share any information with a Service Provider through HealthTap, we will require you to confirm that you agree to any such sharing. As used in this question and answer, “Service Providers” does not include HealthTap Medical Experts.

Every user has a Public Profile. Your Public Profile is how other users will see you on the Site. Your Public Profile is your Public Profile Name, and an image or avatar you choose (your Public Profile Picture). It does not contain any Personally Identifiable Information, unless you put such information in your Public Profile Name or Public Profile Picture. Do not use your real name, picture or any other Personally Identifiable Information in your Public Profile Name and avatar. Each user’s Public Profile is linked to that user’s Health Activity, so that all users on the Site can find similar Public Profiles, and so that we can all share in communal health learning.

As this example shows, some of the information stored in you Health Activity is displayed in your Public Profile. Your real name, and other Personally Identifiable Information, are never shown in your Public Profile (unless you put it there). You can turn off sharing of various site features, including Health Activity sharing, at any time.

IF YOU CHOOSE TO SHARE INFORMATION OUTISDE OF HEALTAP, THIS IS YOUR CHOICE. THERE IS ALWAYS A CHANCE THAT INFOMRATION YOU SHARE OUTSIDE OF HEALTHTAP MAY BE USED IN AN ATTEMPT T IDENTIFY YOU OR MAY BE USED IN WAYS THAT YOU OR HEALTHTAP CANNOT CONTROL.

Each HealthTap user has a Public Profile. HealthTap allows users to find other people who are similar to them by navigating through the site. Each user's Public Profile contains information that is visible to other users on HealthTap. To protect your identity, your real name or other Personally Identifiable Information is never displayed in your Public Profile.

When one user follows another, the follower will see certain information about the user being followed. This information includes certain updates that the user being followed provides to HealthTap and that appear in the Public Profile of the user being followed.

Aggregated information is information from multiple users that is not associated with any individual user account, statistics are summaries of information, not associated with any individual user account, and de-identified data does not include Personally Identifiable Information, such as first and last names or e-mail addresses. Aggregated information and de-identified data and statistics are used to run our service. We may use aggregated information or de-identified data gathered from HealthTap and related statistics to improve the services provided through HealthTap, and for research and analysis. We may also provide this information to our partners for such purposes.

Currently, we only let you provide us with information about you (except in the case of a Caregiver providing information about a Care Recipient). This Privacy Statement applies to this information. In the future, we may allow users to provide us with information by or through other separately operated products or services.

Some users may want to share personal information with a Service Provider. You can always do this on your own. If we allow this in the future, before you share any information with a Service Provider through HealthTap, we will require you to confirm that you agree to any such sharing.

We are committed to protecting the privacy of children. This Site is not intended or designed for children under the age of 13. We do not collect Personally Identifiable Information from any person we actually know is a child under the age of 13. A Caregiver may use this site for a Care Recipient who is under the age of 13, but the Care Recipient may not enter any Personally Identifiable Information into the site – all such information must be entered by the Caregiver.

You have jock itch, so buy some OTC Lotrimin cream and use it twice a day for 2 weeks. Keep your groin dry, and your rash should be gone in a couple of weeks.

Itchy, reddened, slightly flaky skin in the groin skin folds can be from jock itch or other causes. Jock itch (tinea cruris) is caused by a fungus germ, and is usually treated with over-the-counter Lotrimin AF cream or with prescription anti-fungal medication from a doctor.

You, a physician applying to or currently providing virtual consults on HealthTap or any physician on whose behalf this Agreement is entered into (“Provider”), agree to designate HealthTap to purchase and maintain malpractice insurance with a minimum annual coverage of one million dollars per incident and three million dollars in aggregate, or HealthTap’s subsequent liability minimums, to cover any acts of malpractice committed during the performance of virtual consults on HealthTap, subject to any limitations specified herein or in the policy (“Insurance”). Generally, the Insurance provides claims-made coverage for medical malpractice claims brought in the U.S., including U.S. claims made by claimants in other countries. The coverage excludes consults or interactions outside of the HealthTap platform, claims brought outside of the U.S., and is not available to Providers with no other means of participating in a Patient Compensation Fund (“PCF”) program if the Provider practices in a state where PCF participation is required. The Insurance is secondary to any other applicable or available insurance policy. Provider agrees to provide to HealthTap or the Insurance carrier, upon request, information related to your medical practice, licensure, or events or circumstances likely to impact coverage eligibility. This agreement is in addition to any other agreements governing use of the HealthTap platform, and any representations and warranties therein. In the event of a claim covered or potentially covered by the Insurance and related to services provided under this Agreement and on or through a HealthTap platform (including the HealthTap website and mobile apps), Provider agrees to comply with the terms required by the Insurance to receive the benefit of coverage and to: (i) cooperate with the investigation, settlement of defense of any claim(s); (ii) immediately send HealthTap copies of any demands, notices, summons or legal papers received in connection with a claim; (iii) notify any other insurer whose coverage is or may be available; (iv) cooperate with the insurer with respect to coordinating any other available or potentially available insurance; (v) provide the insurer with written authorization to (a) obtain records and other information related to the claim, and (b) conduct and control the defense of the Physician in such claim. By opting into this program, Provider agrees that HealthTap may withhold an additional administrative fee for the provision of this service from any payments to Provider. Currently this fee is one dollar ($1) per consult, on top of any other fees applicable to the performance of consults through the HealthTap platform. Provider may opt out of this coverage at any time, but waiting periods may apply to any future request to participate in this program. HealthTap retains the rights to end this program or to end Provider’s participation in this program at any time and for any reason, and shall provide Provider with written notice of any such termination, in which case coverage shall apply to virtual consults up to the date of such termination.
